headline: It’s Trump’s Economy Now and Americans Don’t Seem to Love It
summary: The economy is expanding, but reliance on the artificial intelligence boom — and the stock-market wealth it’s generated — makes growth look lopsided.  Half of the respondents in an October survey by the Harris Poll for Bloomberg News said the economy wasn’t working for them – up from 41% in February – and only one-third said their finances were better than a year ago.  To be sure, analysts caution against reading too much into off-year ballots, and many Trump policies have yet to fully kick in.

raw.headline: It’s Trump’s Economy Now and Americans Don’t Seem to Love It
raw.summary: The economy is expanding, but reliance on the artificial intelligence boom — and the stock-market wealth it’s generated — makes growth look lopsided.  Half of the respondents in an October survey by the Harris Poll for Bloomberg News said the economy wasn’t working for them – up from 41% in February – and only one-third said their finances were better than a year ago.  To be sure, analysts caution against reading too much into off-year ballots, and many Trump policies have yet to fully kick in.

headline: The AI revolution has a power problem
summary: In the race for AI dominance, American tech giants have the money and the chips, but their ambitions have hit a new obstacle: electric power.All this cash has helped alleviate one initial bottleneck: acquiring the millions of chips needed for the computing power race, and the tech giants are accelerating their in-house processor production as they seek to chase global leader Nvidia.

raw.headline: The AI revolution has a power problem
raw.summary: In the race for AI dominance, American tech giants have the money and the chips, but their ambitions have hit a new obstacle: electric power.All this cash has helped alleviate one initial bottleneck: acquiring the millions of chips needed for the computing power race, and the tech giants are accelerating their in-house processor production as they seek to chase global leader Nvidia.

headline: China's "Singles Day" is the biggest sales festival in the world – but is that enough?
summary: Weiwen Han, Bain & Co's APAC Retail Practice Leader, says China's sales "month" may beat America's Cyber Week sales and may still be seeing steady growth, but growth & value aren't as important anymore. He also talks about the global e-commerce market, and evaluates how Chinese players like Alibaba and JD are faring against Amazon.
